newsitem.title: UK: Canada's Fairfax buys reinsurance group Sphere Drake.
newsitem.headline: Canada's Fairfax buys reinsurance group Sphere Drake.

text.p: Canada's Fairfax Financial Holdings Ltd. has agreed to buy Sphere Drake Holdings Ltd., a reinsurer based in Bermuda, for about $138 million plus other payments and the assumption of debt, the companies said Monday.

The deal, the latest in the reinsurance business, would make Fairfax Financial into a major new player in the sector. A year ago it acquired Skandia America Re for $230 million, renaming it Odyssey Reinsurance and giving Fairfax its first foothold outside the United States.
Then it bought Compagnie Transcontinentale de Reassurance from troubled French insurer GAN for about $120 million, providing it with a stronghold in Europe.

The latest deal would give it a presence in the two most important reinsurance centres, London and Bermuda. Reinsurance companies spread the risk taken on by an insurance company in exchange for part of the premium for a policy that the insurer would not otherwise be able to pay on its own.

Under the deal, Sphere Drake shareholders will receive $7.50 a share in cash or stock, or about $138 million, plus $9.86 a share payable in 10 years. Fairfax will also assume Sphere Drake's bank debt of $100 million.

"By joining Fairfax, Sphere Drake Holdings Ltd. will become part of a global insurance and reinsurance group benefiting from the critical mass necessary to be competitive in today's marketplace," Sphere Drake Chief Executive Michael Watson said.
Sphere Drake saw first quarter 1997 profits drop to $2.9 million from $9.6 million a year earlier due to tough market conditions and began a major restructuring of operations in Bermuda and London.
The deal is subject to approval by British and Bermuda regulators and is expected to be completed late this year.
